text:
- [Narrator] Visual inspection
in manufacturing processes

is critical for detecting
defects and ensuring quality.
When those issues aren't caught quickly,
it can result in production line shutdowns

and annual cost overruns and
lost revenue in the millions.

Computer vision quickly and
accurately identifies defects,
such as missing components in products,
part damage like dents or scratches,

or minuscule defects in
products like silicon wafers.

However, implementing a
computer vision solution
can be complex and require expensive
purpose-built smart cameras.

That's why there's Amazon
Lookout for Vision,
a fast and easy way to implement
computer vision based inspection
in industrial process at scale

using cameras you may
have already installed

with no machine learning
experience required.
You start by providing as few as 30 images

for the process you want
to visually inspect.

Amazon Lookout for Vision
automatically creates a model
that analyzes images from your cameras
and monitors the live process line

to spot any differences
compared to the baseline images.

Amazon Lookout for Vision
identifies and reports

visual anomalies in an
easy to use dashboard,

so you can take quick action
to prevent more defects.
Quality managers or process engineers
can view and verify predicted defects.

Once verified, the feedback is
used to update the ML model,
resulting in higher accuracy
and improved performance over time.
The Amazon Lookout for Vision

together with Amazon
Lookout for Equipment,
Amazon Monitron, AWS Panorama,
and Amazon Sagemaker Edge Manager

provide industrial and
manufacturing customers
the most comprehensive suite

of cloud to edge industrial
machine learning services,

increased production
quality and reduced costs
with Amazon Lookout for Vision.
Learn more and get started today.
